data.title: trying hard
data.text:
have been traveling TO NORTH PORT FOR  MANY years. this was once a dive, efforts to fix up are obvious 
fresh paint, clean new beds and bedding and clean rooms . the pool was well maintained, and nice pool side area  and owners are friendly  . some of the sinks in the rooms are cracked and plumbing is old,

data.title: Best staff I have ever had
data.text: Stayed a few days then went back to ohio. The rooms were very clean, the beds were so comfy. Great hot water and pressure for showers. If I needed anything they just brought it up to me. I thought this place was great. This place was much nicer than places that I have paid double or almost triple for. Walking distance to many stores and restaurants.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: On a family trip we stopped  here for the night. Too cold to use the pool. The room was clean, coffee in room, hair dryer, nice Breakfast, very nice staff. Quiet, affordable. This is a good family motel. Will stay here again the next time we are in this town.

data.title: Lousy property -- and they cheated us out of money as well
data.text:
AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.
My husband and I booked a week and half here when we couldn't find much of anything available for "in-season." The place is pretty much a dive. Owner is rude and staff are miserable. Room was old and tired, and we had plumbing problems in the bathroom.

To add insult to injury, we had to change our plans and head home two days early. When I realized this, I went to the owner to change our reservations (we gave 72 hours notice of the change). He told me I had to contact Booking.com since we had booked through them. I did, and they made the change in our user account but said that the motel owner had already processed our payment at check-in so the refund for 2 nights would have to come from him.

He fought us tooth and nail on this; we went back and forth with him and Booking.com a couple of times, and when I called my credit card company it was indeed the property owner who had charged our card and not the booking agency. We continued to try to complete our refund after we returned home (my husband had become ill and I had limited time and energy to fight with the motel owner while trying to get him on the road), but never got those last two nights refunded. Phone messages ignored, email ignored, USPS letter ignored. Such a royal pain.

data.title: Not a place I would stay ever again.
data.text: I was in area working and I would come home and there would no hot water. The man who owns the place would say run the water until it warms up and it never would. Second night he said the batteries for the hot water heater was bad and he would fix it the next day. Third day no difference and I called him and he said that I would have to run it again. After that I just gave up and stayed at a different hotel. Also every night they would have the police here for something.

data.title: Terrible - better go to Venice, FL with more choices
data.text: Apparently this place provides consistently bad experience. Stay away if you are from Eastern Europe and concerned about overall cleanness. They are not having clean rooms and have problems with people with an accent.  There is Venice town just  a few minutes away from the North Port with better hotel selection for the same price.

data.title: Terrible
data.text: Bad experience. Stay away if you are concerned about cleanness. They do not know what they do not do something right. It's just that typical bad experience that brings the bad case and spoils otherwise good vacation. Venice town is just minutes away North Port. There is not traffic there thus I will rather stay in Venice next time with more clean selection.

data.title: Actually not that bad
data.text: This place had tons of horrible reviews. Well thinking that when we went in I was looking for anything and everything to write about! Not bad! Not to bad! Room  was clean, sheets were clean, room was hot but cooled down pretty quick once air was put on, bathroom wasn't bad either! For $75 with tax. I would go again. The room we had was nice. Roomy, clean. The only complaint was dated t.v.'s and the drunks from the bar. They forget what room they were in and had he conversation right out side out door. Walls are paper thin.  Would try again if in area.

data.title: Looking for reasonable value
data.text:
We stayed here for around 4 weeks in February 2015 which is one of the most expensive times to visit Florida due to snowbird season. The value was fairly good for an efficiency room with stove, microwave and full size fridge and with 2 double beds and a fold out twin.

Downside was it was a smoking room and took a while to air out the smell...we really would have preferred a nonsmoking but had little choice.

The owner was very nice and helpful when needed, there is a bar in the front of the building but it caused no issues. It is close enough to most things and certainly did the job for us.

Another downside is the motel was popular with work teams and they could get loud at times but the owner was quick to act on any complaints.

Would I stay here again? Probably.....

Is it good value? Yeah...you get what you pay for......

Is there any reason to drive by and ignore it? No....it is worth considering

data.title: Expensive and Disappointing-- KEEP DRIVING
data.text:
Short and to the point. They advertise Free WiFi, and even boasted about it when I asked how reliable it was. Despite this it rarely functioned without massive lag and constant disconnections. If you need internet for business, as I do, you will need to provide your own. 

One of the basic things you expect from a hotel is hot water. Wherever you go, that's the one thing pretty much every hotel or motel can manage. Not at Budget Inn. Over the couple weeks I stayed there it was at BEST a fifty-fifty chance that my shower would be warm. After a long day at work, coming "home" to an ice cold shower was pretty annoying -- enough that I raised the issue with management. They never corrected it. 

The SAD thing is that this could be a decent hotel. Fix the hot water and internet, continue renovating the rooms, lower the freaking price, and it would be fine.

data.title: Highly do not recommend
data.text: Owner Mike was rude, allowed our pets, but watched us every time week took them to the shoulder of the highway he would come out making sure we didn't let them potty on his property.asking several times if they were going to bark.Even went to our vehicle to look at them. Room,half used shampoo and body wash bottles, the towels were dirty and as big as the floormat, hot water took 5 min to get somewhat hot an only lasted enough to shave one leg. Wouldn't take a bath because the drain is rusted.the sheets feel like a soft plastic. Feel like I'm getting bit all the time. Owner is one of those middle east Indians that are chea, like 7-11 owners. Oh and pet deposit is cash only.

data.title: Better find something else
data.text: It is one of two hotels in Northport, so no choice in the area. The hotel was under renovation but quiet at night. The room was after renovation, but we got two cockroaches. Not a pleasant experience.  Too expensive for the quality it delivers. Will better drive and find another hotel.

data.title: Keep driving
data.text: All Venice hotels were full, so in desporation we stopped here.  What a mistake we would have done better spending the night in the car.  No one seemed to be able to speek english.  Things seemed strange at night, feel there is some prostitution being worked in a couple of rooms.  My wife accidentely left her watch at the motel.  After contacting them every day for a week, finially admitted they had it.  Went back to retreive it and refused to give it back to my wife.  Owner just started screaming and threatning.  We called the police and they got the watch back to my wife.  The only good thing I can say is it had no bed bugs

data.title: Quoted us one price charged another
data.text:
OK let me begin by saying I have low expectations, I mean i knew not to expect much but quoting us one price then charging us another is totally unacceptable. My boyfriend is a disabled veteran who is tax free and they wouldn't even honor that. We were so exhausted and hungry we just gave up and paid the ridiculous $120 over priced dollars. The next morning we checked into a four star resort for $115 a night. 
 Also it was run down smelly and the linens were dirty, both sheets and makeup stained paper thin towels.  Tub wouldn't drain......I could keep going about this dump....
The pool was about the only clean looking thing there.

data.title: Only Hotel in North Port- Go to Port Charlotte or Venice
data.text: I stayed here or tried to for one night, ended up staying with family in North Port while we wait on a closing.  I may move to one in Port Charlotte, it's only a few minutes away!  This place should not be open.  The sheets were scratchy, the blankets or comforter was thin and dirty, the floor was gross, the bathroom- my wife refused to go into it.  Just awful.  That review was misleading, and while I didn't think it would be great we just took at try.  I hope my wife forgives me soon!  I really didn't want to stay with family, and now realize after being here two days how close Port Charlotte is- from cities I have lived in - it's like the same area. It maybe 8 minute drive away?

data.title: very clean place.
data.text: This is the only hotel we found  in north port fl  very clean, updated walking distance restaurant,bar the Owner and the Employess are wonderful we stayed there for 8 days.they had refridgerator,Micro in the room, if we ever go back to north port to visit my family we would stay there again.
